Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw two different types of habitats, one land and one water, such as a forest and a pond.
The student can observe and draw at least three different types of living things found in the land habitat, like trees, squirrels, and ants.
The student can observe and draw at least three different types of living things found in the water habitat, like fish, clams, and water plants.
The student can compare and illustrate the different living things in each habitat, showing how they are unique to their environment.
The student can represent patterns they observe in the diversity of plants and animals in the habitats, highlighting the differences and similarities.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly show the different plants and animals in each habitat.
